wikipedia_page.main: Jamie Douglas (born 4 July 1992) is a Northern Irish professional footballer who plays for Loughgall as a striker.

response: Meanwhile Adam Salley joined on a pre contract from January from Linfield, David McCullough joined from Ards, John Connolly from Armagh City, Chris Lavery from Glentoran, Kyle McVey, Kevin Amuneke, Stefan Lavery from Dungannon Swifts, Adam McCallum from Linfield, Ben Roy from Ards, Jude Ballard from Dergview, Francis Brennan from Dungannon Swifts, Gary Warwick from Lurgan Celtic, Peter Duffin from Tobermory, Kyle Neil and Andy Kilmartin from Glenavon Darren Henderson from Ballymena Utd and the January signings of Gregg Hall from Ards and Jamie Douglas from Loughgall.

In Tiptons first game in charge the Ports secured a 1–1 draw with league leaders Institute and 4 consecutive wins followed against Loughgall, Newry City and Harland and Wolff Welders with anticipation building that a play off spot would have been very much possible. The team were positioned in 4th place needing 3rd to secure a play off place. A huge game away to Newry City followed with three points for the men in red securing a pre play off spot against Newry. The game saw a large and loud travelling support come down in what was effectively a cup final game that ultimately ended 0–0 with a red card for Jamie Douglas and the visitors ultimately coming up short. What was memorable was Newry coach and Portadown legend Mickey Keenan staying behind the come over and applaud the Portadown supporters which was a touch of class from the Newry man of the highest order. The scenes between supporters post match however was unfortunately much less savoury with supporters clashing outside the ground with cars being damaged and a Portadown supporter falling off a roof and being severely injured. Numerous Portadown supporters were banned for life from games and Newry made many changes including putting up a fence at the area involved. It was concluded that with regards to supporters blame lay at both sides.
* Jamie Douglas (footballer) (born 1992), Northern Irish professional footballer
